page.title: List of international presidential trips made by Joko Widodo

revision.comment: /* Multilateral meetings */
revision.text:
[[File:Jokowi Foreign Visits.svg|thumb|261px|Map of international trips made by Joko Widodo as President:{{legend|#4242ff|Visited}} {{legend|#ff4242|Indonesia}}]] {{Joko Widodo series}} This is a '''list of international presidential trips made by [[Joko Widodo]]''' (Jokowi), the 7th [[President of Indonesia]]. He assumed presidency on 20 October 2014. As of October 2018, Jokowi had visited 32 countries. ==2014== {{multiple image |align=center |image1=Vladimir Putin and Joko Widodo, November 2014.jpg |caption1=Jokowi meeting [[Vladimir Putin]] in the [[APEC China 2014|APEC Summit]] |image2=PM Modi and Indonesian President Joko Widodo at Nay Pyi Taw, Myanmar.jpg |caption2=Jokowi meeting [[Narendra Modi]] in [[Naypyidaw]] }} {| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable" border="1" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- !style="width: 15%;"|Dates !style="width: 17%;"|Country !style="width: 15%;"|Locations !style="width: 96%;"|Details |- |8-12 November |{{CHN}} |[[Beijing]] |Jokowi attended [[APEC China 2014]] as his first international conference.{{cite news |last1=Witular |first1=Rendi A. |last2=Widhiarto |first2=Hasyim |title=Jokowi on world stage, first stop Beijing |url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2014/11/09/jokowi-world-stage-first-stop-beijing.html |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=The Jakarta Post |date=9 November 2014}}{{cite news |title=Hari Ke-20 Jokowi-JK: Lawatan Perdana ke Luar Negeri |url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2015/01/29/10474401/Hari.Ke-20.Jokowi-JK.Lawatan.Perdana.ke.Luar.Negeri |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=29 January 2015 |language=id}} |- |12-13 November |{{MYA}} |[[Naypyidaw]] |Jokowi attended his first [[ASEAN Summit]], in addition to the China-ASEAN conference.{{cite web |title=Presiden Jokowi Tekankan Kerja Sama Ekonomi dan Maritim dalam Kemitraan ASEAN-RRT |url=https://www.kemlu.go.id/id/berita/siaran-pers/Pages/Presiden-Jokowi-Tekankan-Kerja-Sama-Ekonomi-dan-Maritim-dalam-Kemitraan-ASEAN-RRT.aspx |website=kemlu.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=14 November 2014}} |- |14-16 November |{{AUS}} |[[Brisbane]] |Jokowi attended his first [[2014 G20 Brisbane summit|G20 summit]]. |} ==2015== {{multiple image |align=center |image1=Benigno S. Aquino III shakes hand with Joko Widodo.jpg |caption1 = Jokowi with [[Benigno Aquino III]] in [[Malacañan Palace]] |image2=Jokowi Xi Jinping 2015.jpg |caption2 = Jokowi with [[Xi Jinping]] |image3=The President Holds a Bilateral Meeting with the President of Indonesia.webm |caption3=Jokowi with [[Barack Obama]] in the [[White House]] }} {| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable" border="1" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- !style="width: 15%;"|Dates !style="width: 17%;"|Country !style="width: 15%;"|Locations !style="width: 96%;"|Details |- |5-7 February |{{MAS}} |[[Putrajaya]] |Jokowi attended bilateral talks with Malaysian PM [[Najib Razak]] to discuss maritime borders and cooperation in addition to Indonesian students and workers in Malaysia.{{cite news |title=Jokowi puas hati, sifatkan lawatan ke Malaysia berjaya - Duta Indonesia |url=http://www.astroawani.com/berita-dunia/jokowi-puas-hati-sifatkan-lawatan-ke-malaysia-berjaya-duta-indonesia-53525 |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Astro Awani |date=7 February 2015 |language=ms}}{{cite news |last1=Sari |first1=Amanda Puspita |title=Wartawan Malaysia Dilarang Meliput Kunjungan Jokowi |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/internasional/20150207143636-106-30350/wartawan-malaysia-dilarang-meliput-kunjungan-jokowi |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=CNN Indonesia |date=7 February 2015 |language=id}} |- |7-8 February |{{BRU}} |[[Bandar Seri Begawan]] |Jokowi attended bilateral talks with Sultan [[Hassanal Bolkiah]], discussing cooperation in trade, labor and defense.{{cite web |title=Inilah Hasil Kunjungan Presiden Jokowi ke Brunei Darussalam |url=http://setkab.go.id/inilah-hasil-kunjungan-presiden-jokowi-ke-brunei-darussalam/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=7 February 2015}} |- |8-10 February |{{PHI}} |[[Manila]] |Jokowi attended bilateral talks with President [[Benigno Aquino III]], discussing maritime boundaries, cooperation in security, education and economics, in addition to protection of citizens and migrant workers.{{cite news |last1=Cabacungan |first1=Gil C. |title=Widodo PH visit boosts Aquino |url=http://globalnation.inquirer.net/118526/widodo-ph-visit-boosts-aquino |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=The Inquirer |date=10 February 2015}} |- |22-25 March |{{JAP}} |[[Tokyo]] |Jokowi visited Japan to engage in talks with PM [[Shinzo Abe]] regarding economic cooperation, specifically infrastructure development.{{cite web |title=Disambut Udara Dingin, Presiden Jokowi Tiba di Tokyo Untuk Kunjungan Kenegaraan |url=http://setkab.go.id/disambut-udara-dingin-presiden-jokowi-tiba-di-tokyo-untuk-kunjungan-kenegaraan/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=22 March 2015}} |- |25-28 March |{{CHN}} |[[Beijing]]
[[Sanya]], [[Hainan]] |Jokowi conducted bilateral talks with [[Xi Jinping]] in Beijing, discussing economic cooperation and infrastructure development in addition to requesting a visa exemption for Indonesian citizens visiting China.{{cite news |title=Jokowi Minta Fasilitas Bebas Visa untuk WNI ke Cina |url=https://www.dw.com/id/jokowi-minta-fasilitas-bebas-visa-untuk-wni-ke-cina/a-18345293 |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=[[Deutsche Welle]] |date=27 March 2015 |language=id}} He then went to [[Sanya]] to conduct bilateral meetings with Dutch PM [[Mark Rutte]] and become a keynote speaker.{{cite web |title=Tiba di Hainan, Presiden Jokowi Bersiap Jadi Pembicara Kunci Pada Boao Forum Asia |url=http://setkab.go.id/tiba-di-hainan-presiden-jokowi-bersiap-jadi-pembicara-kunci-pada-boao-forum-asia/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=27 March 2015}} |- |28-29 March |{{MAS}} |[[Kuala Lumpur]] |Jokowi attended the wedding of Malaysian PM [[Najib Razak]]'s daughter.{{cite web |title=Mampir ke Malaysia, Presiden Jokowi Hadiri Resepsi Pernikahan Putri PM Najib |url=http://setkab.go.id/mampir-ke-malaysia-presiden-jokowi-hadiri-resepsi-pernikahan-putri-pm-najib/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id}} |- |29 March |colspan=2|{{SIN}} |Jokowi attended the [[Death of Lee Kuan Yew|funeral]] of former Singaporean PM [[Lee Kuan Yew]].{{cite news |title=Jokowi Hadiri Kremasi Lee Kuan Yew |url=http://www.tribunnews.com/nasional/2015/03/29/jokowi-hadiri-kremasi-lee-kuan-yew |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Tribunnews.com |date=29 March 2015 |language=id-ID}} |- |26-27 April |{{MAS}} |[[Kuala Lumpur]] |Jokowi attended an [[ASEAN Summit]].{{cite news |title=Indonesia’s Foreign Minister Calls for Code of Conduct in South China Sea |url=https://jakartaglobe.id/news/indonesias-foreign-minister-calls-for-code-of-conduct-in-south-china-sea/ |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Jakarta Globe |date=27 April 2015 |language=id}} |- |11-12 May |{{PNG}} |[[Port Moresby]] |Jokowi signed agreements on cross-border crime, human resources cooperation, and economic cooperation with PNG PM [[Peter O'Neill]].{{cite web |title=Inilah Kesepakatan Kerjasama Yang Dicapai Dalam Kunjungan Presiden Jokowi Ke PNG |url=http://setkab.go.id/inilah-kesepakatan-kerjasama-yang-dicapai-dalam-kunjungan-presiden-jokowi-ke-png/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=12 May 2015}} |- |28-29 July |colspan=2|{{SIN}} |Jokowi met Singaporean president [[Tony Tan Keng Yam]] and PM [[Lee Hsien Loong]] to discuss economic cooperation.{{cite web |title=Press Release Kunjungan Kenegaraan Presiden Jokowi ke Singapura |url=https://www.kemlu.go.id/id/berita/siaran-pers/Pages/Press-Release-Kunjungan-Kenegaraan-Presiden-Jokowi-ke-Singapura.aspx |website=kemlu.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=27 July 2015}} |- |11-13 September |{{SAU}} |[[Jeddah]] |Jokowi arrived just after the [[Mecca crane collapse]] which killed 11 Indonesians, and held a press conference upon landing. The bilateral talks with [[Salman of Saudi Arabia|King Salman]] involved defense cooperation, hajj affairs, investment, and a request of clemency for 4 Indonesians on death row.{{cite news |last1=Rimadi |first1=Luqman |title=Kunjungan Istimewa Jokowi di Timur Tengah |url=https://www.liputan6.com/news/read/2318318/kunjungan-istimewa-jokowi-di-timur-tengah |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=liputan6.com |date=16 September 2015 |language=id}}{{cite news |title=FOTO: Kunjungan Jokowi ke Arab Saudi |url=https://www.rappler.com/indonesia/105729-foto-kunjungan-jokowi-arab-saudi |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Rappler |date=13 September 2015 |language=id}} |- |13-14 September |{{UAE}} |[[Abu Dhabi]]
[[Dubai]] |Jokowi met with crown prince [[Mohammed Bin Zayed Al Nahyan]] in [[Abu Dhabi]] and discussed investment.{{cite web |title=Tiba Di Abu Dhabi, Presiden Jokowi Disambut Putra Mahkota UEA |url=http://setkab.go.id/tiba-di-abu-dhabi-presiden-jokowi-disambut-putra-pangeran-uea/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=13 September 2015}} Later, he went to [[Dubai]] for a working visit.{{cite web |title=Kunjungan Kerja Presiden RI Joko Widodo ke Dubai |url=https://www.kemlu.go.id/dubai/id/berita-agenda/berita-perwakilan/Pages/Kunjungan-Kerja-Presiden-RI-Joko-Widodo-ke-Dubai.aspx |website=kemlu.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id}} |- |14-15 September |{{QAT}} |[[Doha]] |Jokowi met with Qatari businessmen and urged them to invest in Indonesia.{{cite web |title=Bertemu Pengusaha Qatar, Presiden Jokowi: Saat Ini Waktu Yang Tepat Investasi Di Indonesia |url=http://setkab.go.id/bertemu-pengusaha-qatar-presiden-jokowi-saat-ini-waktu-yang-tepat-investasi-di-indonesia/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=15 September 2015}} |- |25-28 October |{{USA}} |[[Washington, D.C.]]
[[San Francisco]] |Jokowi conducted bilateral talks with US President [[Barack Obama]] in the [[White House]] regarding investment and religious tolerance, issuing a joint statement on maritime, defense, economic and energy cooperation, before heading to meet business and academic leaders in San Francisco.{{cite web |title=25 – 28 Oktober, Presiden Jokowi Akan Berkunjung Ke AS |url=http://setkab.go.id/25-28-oktober-presiden-jokowi-akan-berkunjung-ke-as/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id}}{{cite web |title=Joint Statement by the United States of America and the Republic of Indonesia |url=https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/the-press-office/2015/10/26/joint-statement-united-states-america-and-republic-indonesia |website=whitehouse.gov |accessdate=12 October 2018 |date=26 October 2015}} |- |15-16 November |{{TUR}} |[[Antalya]] |Jokowi participated in the [[2015 G20 Antalya summit]], holding talks with [[Xi Jinping]] and newly elected [[Justin Trudeau]].{{cite web |title=Hujan Lebat di Jakarta Sambut Kedatangan Presiden Jokowi dari Turki |url=http://setkab.go.id/hujan-lebat-di-jakarta-sambut-kedatangan-presiden-jokowi-dari-turki/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id}} |- |30 November-2 December |{{FRA}} |[[Paris]] |Jokowi attended the [[COP 21]], where he gave a speech committing to reducing Indonesia's emission by 29 percent in 2030 (or 41 percent with international support), and increasing renewable energy shares to 23 percent by 2025.{{cite web |last1=Setiawan |first1=Alfurkon |title=President Jokowi: Indonesia Commits Reducing Emission by 29% |url=http://setkab.go.id/en/president-jokowi-indonesia-commits-reducing-emission-by-29/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id}} |} ==2016== {{multiple image |align=center |image1=Jokowi and Sundar Pichai Googleplex.jpg |caption1 = Jokowi with Google CEO [[Sundar Pichai]] in [[Googleplex]] |image2=Macri with Widodo.jpg |caption2 = Jokowi with Argentinian president [[Mauricio Macri]] during the [[2016 G20 Hangzhou summit|G20 summit]] }} {| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable" border="1" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- !style="width: 15%;"|Dates !style="width: 17%;"|Country !style="width: 15%;"|Locations !style="width: 96%;"|Details |- |26 January |{{ETM}} |[[Dili]] |Jokowi met with East Timorese PM [[Rui Maria de Araujo]] and President [[Taur Matan Ruak]].{{cite web |title=Agenda Presiden Sehari di Timor Leste: Dari Blusukan sampai Ketemu Warga Indonesia |url=http://presidenri.go.id/berita-aktual/agenda-presiden-sehari-di-timor-leste-dari-blusukan-sampai-ketemu-warga-indonesia.html |website=presidenri.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=26 January 2016}} |- |15-17 February |{{USA}} |[[California]] |Jokowi attended the ASEAN-US Summit and visited tech companies in [[Silicon Valley]].{{cite news |last1=Kusumadewi |first1=Anggi |title=Presiden Jokowi Tiba di California Amerika Serikat |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20160215095759-20-110904/presiden-jokowi-tiba-di-california-amerika-serikat |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=CNN Indonesia |date=15 February 2016 |language=id}} |- |17-19 April |{{GER}} |[[Berlin]] |Jokowi met German president [[Joachim Gauck]] and chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] to discuss investment and labor training, before speaking in the German-Indonesian business forum.{{cite news |last1=Iqbal |first1=M. |title=Melihat Lebih Jelas Hasil Kunjungan Presiden Jokowi ke Eropa |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-3195804/melihat-lebih-jelas-hasil-kunjungan-presiden-jokowi-ke-eropa?single=1 |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=detiknews |date=25 April 2016 |language=id}} |- |19-21 April |{{GBR}} |[[London]] |Jokowi met British PM [[David Cameron]]. |- |21-22 April |{{BEL}} |[[Brussels]] |Jokowi visited the [[European Union]] office and met with its leaders [[Martin Schulz]], [[Donald Tusk]] and [[Jean-Claude Juncker]] to discuss the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement and trade affairs, before meeting CEOs from Nordic countries and attending a reception by King [[Philippe of Belgium]]. |- |22-23 April |{{flag|Netherlands}} |[[Amsterdam]]
[[Leiden]]
[[Rotterdam]] |Jokowi met with PM [[Mark Rutte]] and discussed water management, maritime affairs, trade and investment. He also visited the [[University of Leiden]] and [[Port of Rotterdam]]. |- |15-17 May |{{KOR}} |[[Seoul]] |Jokowi fulfilled an invitation by president [[Park Geun-Hye]] and discussed about South Korea being a partner in accelerating Indonesian industrialization.{{cite news |title=Apa saja agenda Jokowi di Korea Selatan dan Rusia? |url=https://www.rappler.com/indonesia/133737-agenda-kunjungan-jokowi-korea-selatan-rusia |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Rappler |date=20 May 2016 |language=id}} |- |18-20 May |{{RUS}} |[[Sochi]] |Jokowi attended the ASEAN-Russia summit, in addition to meeting with Russian president [[Vladimir Putin]] and several Russian businessman. |- |26-27 May |{{JPN}} |[[Shima, Mie]] |Jokowi was invited as a guest to the [[42nd G7 summit]].{{cite news |last1=Agustina |first1=Widiarsi |title=Presiden Jokowi Tiba di Jepang untuk G7 Outreach |url=https://nasional.tempo.co/read/774363/presiden-jokowi-tiba-di-jepang-untuk-g7-outreach |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Tempo |date=26 May 2016 |language=id-ID}} |- |2-6 September |{{CHN}} |[[Hangzhou]] |Jokowi attended the [[2016 G20 Hangzhou summit]], and met with [[Xi Jinping]] in addition to Alibaba CEO [[Jack Ma]].{{cite news |last1=Amindoni |first1=Ayomi |title=Jokowi arrives in China for G20 Summit |url=http://www.thejakartapost.com/news/2016/09/02/jokowi-arrives-in-china-for-g20-summit.html |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=The Jakarta Post |date=2 September 2016 |language=en}} |- |6-8 September |{{LAO}} |[[Vientiane]] |Jokowi attended the [[ASEAN summit]].{{cite web |title=Presiden Jokowi Hadiri KTT ASEAN di Laos |url=http://presidenri.go.id/berita-aktual/presiden-jokowi-hadiri-ktt-asean-di-laos.html |website=presidenri.go,id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=7 September 2016}} |- |12-14 December |{{IND}} |[[New Delhi]] |Jokowi met with PM [[Narendra Modi]] to discuss economic cooperation and the [[Indian Ocean Rim Association]].{{cite news |last1=Nugroho |first1=Bagus Prihantoro |title=Jokowi Berada di New Delhi, akan Bertemu PM dan Presiden India |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-3368974/jokowi-berada-di-new-delhi-akan-bertemu-pm-dan-presiden-india |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=detiknews |date=12 December 2016 |language=id}} |- |14-15 December |{{IRN}} |[[Teheran]] |Jokowi met with Iranian president [[Hassan Rouhani]] to discuss cooperation, mainly in the energy sector.{{cite web |title=Menlu: Kunjungan Presiden Jokowi ke Iran Fokus Pada Kerjasama Bidang Migas |url=http://setkab.go.id/menlu-kunjungan-presiden-jokowi-ke-iran-fokus-pada-kerjasama-bidang-migas/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=14 December 2016}} |} ==2017== {{multiple images |align=center |image1=Joko Widodo and Malcolm Turnbull in Sydney 2017 14.jpg |caption1 = Jokowi with [[Malcolm Turnbull]] in Sydney |image2=Brunei Darussalam Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah, People's Republic of China Premier Li Keqiang, Cambodia Prime Minister Hun Sen, Indonesia President Joko Widodo, and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi at the 31st ASEAN Summit.jpg |caption2 = Jokowi with [[Hassanal Bolkiah]], [[Li Keqiang]], [[Hun Sen]] and [[Narendra Modi]] during the 31st ASEAN Summit |image3=President Trump's Trip to Germany and the G20 Summit (35450048090).jpg |caption3 = Jokowi with US president [[Donald Trump]] and [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]] chairman [[Christine Lagarde]] in the [[2017 G20 Hamburg summit|Hamburg G20 summit]] }} {| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable" border="1" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- !style="width: 15%;"|Dates !style="width: 17%;"|Country !style="width: 15%;"|Locations !style="width: 96%;"|Details |- |25-27 February |{{AUS}} |[[Sydney]] |Jokowi met with PM [[Malcolm Turnbull]] and conducted bilateral talks on trade.{{cite news |last1=Deny |first1=Septian |title=Ini Hasil Kunjungan Jokowi ke Australia di Bidang Ekonomi |url=https://www.liputan6.com/bisnis/read/2869675/ini-hasil-kunjungan-jokowi-ke-australia-di-bidang-ekonomi |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=liputan6.com |date=27 February 2017 |language=id}} |- |28-30 April |{{PHI}} |[[Manila]] |Jokowi attended the [[ASEAN Summit]] and conducted bilateral talks with Filipino president [[Rodrigo Duterte]], in addition to inaugurating a new sea route between [[Davao City|Davao]]-[[General Santos]]-[[Bitung]].{{cite web |title=Bertolak Menuju Manila, Presiden Jokowi Hadiri KTT ASEAN ke-30 |url=https://www.kemlu.go.id/id/berita/Pages/Ke-Manila,-Presiden-Jokowi-Hadiri-KTT-ASEAN-ke-30.aspx |website=kemlu.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=28 April 2017}} |- |30 April-1 May |colspan=2|{{HKG}} |Jokowi visited [[Hong Kong]] and met with Indonesians workers there, before meeting executive [[Leung Chun-Ying]] and business leaders.{{cite news |last1=Siu |first1=Phila |title=Indonesian President Joko Widodo gets hero’s welcome from compatriots in Hong Kong |url=https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/2091847/indonesian-president-joko-widodo-gets-heros-welcome |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=South China Morning Post |date=30 April 2017}} |- |14-15 May |{{CHN}} |[[Beijing]] |Jokowi attended the first [[Belt and Road Forum]] and signed with [[Xi Jinping]] a five-year comprehensive Indonesia-China strategic partnership.{{cite web |title=President Jokowi Discusses Infrastructure Projects with President Xi Jinping |url=http://setkab.go.id/en/president-jokowi-discusses-infrastructure-projects-with-president-xi-jinping/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=15 May 2017}} |- |21 May |{{SAU}} |[[Riyadh]] |Jokowi attended the [[Arab Islamic American Summit]].{{cite web |title=Hadiri KTT Arab Islam Amerika, Presiden Jokowi Sampaikan Upaya Indonesia Atasi Terorisme |url=http://setkab.go.id/hadiri-ktt-arab-islam-amerika-presiden-jokowi-sampaikan-upaya-indonesia-atasi-terorisme/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id}} |- |5-6 July |{{TUR}} |[[Ankara]] |Jokowi met with Turkish president [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]] and discussed economic, industrial and counter-terrorism cooperation.{{cite news |last1=Indra |first1=Rahman |title=Presiden Jokowi dan Keluarga Tiba di Turki |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/nasional/20170706093722-20-226031/presiden-jokowi-dan-keluarga-tiba-di-turki |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=CNN Indonesia |date=6 July 2017 |language=id}} |- |6-9 July |{{GER}} |[[Hamburg]] |Jokowi attended the [[2017 G20 Hamburg summit]], where he conducted talks with US president [[Donald Trump]], among others.{{cite web |title=Di Hamburg Hari Ini, Presiden Jokowi Bertemu PM Australia dan PM Belanda |url=http://setkab.go.id/di-hamburg-hari-ini-presiden-jokowi-bertemu-pm-australia-dan-pm-belanda/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=7 July 2017}} |- |6-7 September |colspan=2|{{SIN}} |Jokowi visited Singapore to commemorate 50 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries, and met with Singaporean PM [[Lee Hsien Long]].{{cite news |title=Jokowi Terbang ke Singapura Siang Nanti, Ini Agendanya |url=https://www.liputan6.com/news/read/3084138/jokowi-terbang-ke-singapura-siang-nanti-ini-agendanya |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=liputan6.com |date=6 September 2017 |language=id}} |- |10-12 November |{{VIE}} |[[Đà Nẵng]] |Jokowi attended the [[APEC Vietnam 2017]] summit.{{cite news |title=Jokowi Attends APEC, ASEAN Summits in Vietnam, the Philippines |url=https://en.tempo.co/read/news/2017/11/10/055913127/Jokowi-Attends-APEC-ASEAN-Summits-in-Vietnam-the-Philippines |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Tempo |date=10 November 2017}} |- |12-16 November |{{PHI}} |[[Manila]] |Jokowi attended the ASEAN summit.{{cite news |last1=Waluyo |first1=Andylala |title=Jokowi dan Sekjen PBB Sepakati Penyelesaian Krisis Kemanusiaan di Rakhine State dan Kemerdekaan Bangsa Palestina |url=https://www.voaindonesia.com/a/jokowi-dan-sekjen-pbb-sepakati-penyelesaian-krisis-kemanusiaan-di-rakhine-state-dan-kemerdekaan-bangsa-palestina/4116466.html |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=VOA Indonesia |date=16 November 2017 |language=id}} |- |22 November |{{MAS}} |[[Kuching]] |Jokowi attended an annual meeting with Malaysian PM [[Najib Razak]].{{cite news |title=Di Kuching, Jokowi-Najib Hasilkan Enam Lembar Kesepakatan |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/internasional/20171122211222-106-257487/di-kuching-jokowi-najib-hasilkan-enam-lembar-kesepakatan |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=CNN Indonesia |date=22 November 2017 |language=id}} |- |13-14 December |{{TUR}} |[[Istanbul]] |Jokowi attended the special [[Organization of Islamic Cooperation|OIC]] summit regarding [[United States recognition of Jerusalem as capital of Israel|American recognition of Jerusalem as the Israeli capital]], and condemned Trump's decision.{{cite web |title=Berbicara di KTT LB OKI, Presiden Jokowi Sampaikan Enam Usulan |url=https://www.kemlu.go.id/id/berita/berita-perwakilan/Pages/Berbicara-di-KTT-LB-OKI,-Presiden-Jokowi-Sampaikan-Enam-Usulan.aspx |website=kemlu.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=14 December 2017}} |} ==2018== {{multiple images |align=center |image1 = Jokowi Ashraf Gani 2018.jpg |caption1 = Jokowi with Afghan president [[Ashraf Ghani]] |image2=Jokowi Moon Jae In 2018.jpg |caption2 = Jokowi with South Korean president [[Moon Jae-in]] |image3 =Joko Widodo Mike Pence Singapore 2018.jpg |caption3 =Jokowi with US Vice President [[Mike Pence]] }} {| class="wikitable outercollapse sortable" border="1" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- !style="width: 15%;"|Dates !style="width: 17%;"|Country !style="width: 15%;"|Locations !style="width: 96%;"|Details |- |24-25 January |{{SRI}} |[[Colombo]] |Jokowi met with Sri Lankan president [[Maithripala Sirisena]] and discussed trade and economic affairs.{{cite news |title=Hasil Kunjungan Jokowi ke Sri Lanka: Indonesia Akan Ekspor Gerbong Kereta |url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2018/01/25/13440161/hasil-kunjungan-jokowi-ke-sri-lanka-indonesia-akan-ekspor-gerbong-kereta |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=25 January 2018 |language=id}} |- |25-26 January |{{IND}} |[[New Delhi]] |Jokowi attended the ASEAN-India summit, then held bilateral talks with Indian PM [[Narendra Modi]] on trade. Jokowi left New Delhi after meeting Vietnamese PM [[Nguyễn Xuân Phúc]].{{cite news |title=Temui PM India, Jokowi Minta Tarif Bea "Vegetables Oil" Diturunkan |url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2018/01/26/09591791/temui-pm-india-jokowi-minta-tarif-bea-vegetables-oil-diturunkan |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=26 January 2018 |language=id}}{{cite news |title=Setelah Hadiri Parade Hari Republik India, Presiden Jokowi Bertolak Ke Pakistan |url=http://www.tribunnews.com/nasional/2018/01/27/setelah-hadiri-parade-hari-republik-india-presiden-jokowi-bertolak-ke-pakistan |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Tribunnews.com |date=27 January 2018 |language=id-ID}} |- |26-27 January |{{PAK}} |[[Islamabad]] |Jokowi visited the [[National Assembly of Pakistan]], met with president [[Mamnoon Hussain]] and PM [[Shahid Khaqan Abbasi]].{{cite news |title=Tiba di Pakistan, Ini Rencana Kegiatan Presiden Jokowi dan Iriana |url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2018/01/26/19454381/tiba-di-pakistan-ini-rencana-kegiatan-presiden-jokowi-dan-iriana |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=26 January 2018 |language=id}} |- |27-29 January |{{BAN}} |[[Dhaka]]
[[Cox's Bazar]] |Jokowi met Bengali PM [[Sheikh Hasina]] for bilateral talks, and visited [[Rohingya]] refugee camps in [[Cox's Bazar]].{{cite news |last1=Deny |first1=Septian |title=Ini Hasil Kunjungan Jokowi ke Bangladesh |url=https://www.liputan6.com/bisnis/read/3241988/ini-hasil-kunjungan-jokowi-ke-bangladesh |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=liputan6.com |date=29 January 2018 |language=id}}{{cite news |last1=Hasan |first1=Rizki Akbar |title=Jokowi Melawat ke Kamp Pengungsi Rohingya di Bangladesh |url=https://www.liputan6.com/global/read/3241425/jokowi-melawat-ke-kamp-pengungsi-rohingya-di-bangladesh |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=liputan6.com |date=28 January 2018 |language=id}} |- |29 January |{{AFG}} |[[Kabul]] |Jokowi visited Afghanistan for six hours, meeting president [[Ashraf Ghani]] and conducted bilateral talks, stating that Indonesia will help in peacebulding and reconciliation in Afghanistan.{{cite news |last1=Jordan |first1=Ray |title=Sampaikan Duka, Jokowi: Indonesia Dukung Perdamaian di Afghanistan |url=https://news.detik.com/berita/d-3839997/sampaikan-duka-jokowi-indonesia-dukung-perdamaian-di-afghanistan |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=detiknews |date=29 January 2018 |language=id}}{{cite web |title=Kunjungan Presiden Jokowi ke Afghanistan, Pertemuan Dua Sahabat |url=http://setkab.go.id/kunjungan-presiden-jokowi-ke-afghanistan-pertemuan-dua-sahabat/ |website=setkab.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=30 January 2018}} |- |15-18 March |{{AUS}} |[[Sydney]] |Jokowi attended the ASEAN-Australia forum and engaged in bilateral talks with Australian PM [[Malcolm Turnbull]].{{cite news |title=Ini agenda Presiden Jokowi selama di Australia |url=https://nasional.kontan.co.id/news/ini-agenda-presiden-jokowi-selama-di-australia |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Kontan |date=17 March 2018 |language=id}} |- |18-20 March |{{NZL}} |[[Wellington]] |Jokowi conducted bilateral talks and commemorated the 60 year anniversary of [[Indonesia-New Zealand relations]].{{cite news |title=Seusai KTT ASEAN-Australia, Jokowi ke Selandia Baru |url=https://www.cnnindonesia.com/internasional/20180319061209-113-284050/seusai-ktt-asean-australia-jokowi-ke-selandia-baru |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=CNN Indonesia |date=19 March 2018 |language=id}} |- |27-28 April |colspan=2|{{SIN}} |Jokowi attended the 32nd [[ASEAN Summit]] and conducted bilateral talks with other leaders, such as Singaporean PM [[Lee Hsien Long]] and Burmese president [[Win Myint (politician)|Win Myint]].{{cite news |last1=Fakhri |first1=Fakhrizal |title=Ini Agenda Presiden Jokowi Selama Kunjungan ke Singapura |url=https://news.okezone.com/read/2018/04/27/337/1892212/ini-agenda-presiden-jokowi-selama-kunjungan-ke-singapura |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Okezone |date=27 April 2018 |language=id-ID}}{{cite web |title=Presiden Jokowi Bertolak ke KTT ASEAN |url=https://www.kemlu.go.id/id/berita/siaran-pers/Pages/Presiden-Jokowi-Bertolak-ke-KTT-ASEAN.aspx |website=kemlu.go.id |accessdate=12 October 2018 |language=id |date=27 April 2018}} |- |9-11 September |{{KOR}} |[[Seoul]] |Jokowi met South Korean business leaders and conducted bilateral talks with president [[Moon Jae-in]].{{cite news |title=8 Kegiatan Jokowi di Korea Selatan, dari Blusukan hingga Bertemu Super Junior |url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2018/09/12/10595971/8-kegiatan-jokowi-di-korea-selatan-dari-blusukan-hingga-bertemu-super-junior?page=all |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=12 September 2018 |language=id}} |- |11-12 September |{{VIE}} |[[Hanoi]] |Jokowi conducted bilateral talks with Vietnamese PM [[Nguyễn Xuân Phúc]], before attending the [[World Economic Forum]] on ASEAN.{{cite news |last1=Florentin |first1=Vindry |title=Dari Korsel Presiden Jokowi Langsung ke Vietnam, Ini Agendanya |url=https://nasional.tempo.co/read/1125663/dari-korsel-presiden-jokowi-langsung-ke-vietnam-ini-agendanya/full&view=ok |accessdate=12 October 2018 |work=Tempo |date=11 September 2018 |language=id}} |- |13-15 November |colspan=2|{{SIN}} |Jokowi attended the 33rd ASEAN Summit, and had bilateral meetings with Russian president [[Vladimir Putin]], Chilean president [[Michelle Bachelet]] and Japanese PM [[Shinzo Abe]].{{cite news |last1=Ichwan |first1=Alif |title=Hadiri KTT ke-33 ASEAN, Ini Agenda Presiden Jokowi di Singapura |url=https://nasional.kompas.com/read/2018/11/13/09065581/hadiri-ktt-ke-33-asean-ini-agenda-presiden-jokowi-di-singapura |accessdate=14 November 2018 |work=KOMPAS |date=13 November 2018 |language=id}} |- |15-18 November |{{PNG}} |[[Port Moresby]] |Jokowi attended the [[APEC Papua New Guinea 2018]] summit. |} ==Multilateral meetings== The following multilateral meetings are scheduled to take place during Jokowi's 2014–2019 term in office.

page.title: List of international presidential trips made by Mauricio Macri

revision.comment: Moving from [[Category:Diplomatic visits by heads of state]] to [[Category:Lists of diplomatic visits by heads of state]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2017}} This is a '''list of international presidential trips made by Mauricio Macri''', the [[List of Presidents of Argentina|53rd]] and current [[President of Argentina|President]] of Argentina. During his presidency, [[Mauricio Macri]] has visited 20 countries as of May 2017. ==Summary of international trips== {{further|Foreign relations of Argentina}} {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- !Number of visits !Country |- |4 visits |[[United States]] |- |3 visits |[[Chile]] |- |2 visits |[[China]], [[Colombia]], [[Germany]], [[Italy]], [[Paraguay]], [[Peru]], [[Vatican City]] |- |1 visit |[[Belgium]], [[Brazil]], [[Canada]], [[Ecuador]], [[France]], [[Japan]], [[Netherlands]], [[Qatar]], [[Spain]], [[Switzerland]], [[United Arab Emirates]], [[Uruguay]] |} ==2015== The following international trips were made by President Mauricio Macri in 2015: [[File:Dilma y macri.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Macri made his first visit as President-Elect to [[Brasilia]] for a meeting with President [[Dilma Rousseff]].]] {| class="wikitable" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{flag|Paraguay}} |[[Asunción]] |21 December |{{further|Argentina–Paraguay relations}}During his first participation in the [[Mercosur]] Summit, President Macri called for "the prompt release of political prisoners in Venezuela" and warned that the regional bloc "can be no room for political persecution for ideological reasons or illegitimate forecast freedom for thinking differently". He also called for jointly fight against poverty and drug trafficking.{{cite news|title=Macri, en la cumbre del Mercosur: "Pido por la pronta liberación de los presos políticos en Venezuela|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1856105-mauricio-macri-asuncion-cumbre-mercosur|accessdate=21 December 2015|work=La Nacion|date=21 December 2015}} |} ==2016== The following international trips were made by President Mauricio Macri in 2016: [[File:Macri Hollande2.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Macri with [[François Hollande]] shake hands at the Elysee palace in Paris on 2 July 2016 ahead of their meeting.]] [[File:Macri and Merkel.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Macri with Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] in Berlin, during his official visit to Germany, July 2016.]] [[File:MacriONU04.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Macri speaking at the 71st General Assembly of the United Nations in New York.]] {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{flag|Uruguay}} |[[Colonia del Sacramento]] |7 January |{{further|Argentina–Uruguay relations}}President Macri traveled to Uruguay, for a meeting with President [[Tabare Vazquez]], under the start of his international agenda. They officially postulated the [[Uruguay–Argentina 2030 FIFA World Cup bid]].{{cite news|title=Macri y Tabaré impulsan a la Argentina y Uruguay como sede conjunta del Mundial 2030 |url=http://www.clarin.com/deportes/futbol-internacional/Macri-Argentina-Uruguay-organicen-Mundial_0_1499850322.html|accessdate=7 January 2016|work=Clarin|date=7 January 2016}} |- |{{flag|Switzerland}} |[[Davos]] |20–23 January |{{further|Argentina–Switzerland relations}}President Macri traveled to the [[World Economic Forum]] Summit in [[Davos]] accompanied by his former rival in the presidential elections [[Sergio Massa]].{{cite news|title=Sergio Massa viajará con Mauricio Macri a la cumbre de Davos|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1859538-sergio-massa-viajara-con-mauricio-macri-a-la-cumbre-de-davos|accessdate=5 January 2016|work=La Nacion|date=5 January 2016}} |- |{{flag|Vatican City}}
{{flag|Italy}} |Vatican City
[[Rome]] |27 February |{{further|Argentina–Holy See relations|Argentina-Italy relations}}President Macri visited [[Pope Francis]] in his first visit to the Vatican as [[President of Argentina|President]]. After that, Macri met with Italian Prime Minister, [[Matteo Renzi]]. |- |{{flag|United States}} |[[Washington D.C.]] |31 March
1 April |{{further|Argentina–United States relations}}President Macri traveled to the U.S. on the occasion of the [[2016 Nuclear Security Summit]]. |- |{{flag|Colombia}} |[[Bogotá]]
[[Medellín]] |15–16 June |{{further|Argentina–Colombia relations}}President Macri traveled to Colombia for a meeting with President [[Juan Manuel Santos]]. After that, Macri participated in the [[World Economic Forum|World Economic Forum on Latin America 2016]]. |- |{{flag|Chile}} |[[Puerto Varas]] |30 June
1 July |{{further|Argentina–Chile relations}}President Macri traveled to Chile for the Summit of the [[Pacific Alliance]]. |- |{{flag|France}} |[[Paris]] |2 July |{{further|Argentina–France relations}}President Macri opened his European tour in Paris meeting with French President [[François Hollande]]. He said the meeting was "very good" and expressed his desire to increase trade between [[Mercosur]] and the [[European Union]].{{cite news|title=Macri abrió su gira europea en París con Hollande|url=http://www.elintransigente.com/politica/2016/7/2/macri-abrio-gira-europea-paris-hollande-391121.html|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=El Intransigente|date= 2 July 2016}} |- |{{flag|Belgium}} |[[Brussels]] |3–4 July |{{further|Argentina–Belgium relations}}President Macri met with the High Representative of the European Union for Foreign Policy, [[Federica Mogherini]], at the headquarters of the European Commission, and then have lunch with President of the European Council, [[Donald Tusk]], at that institution. In the afternoon he was received along with his wife, the First Lady [[Juliana Awada]] at the [[Royal Palace of Brussels]] by [[Philippe of Belgium|King Philippe]] and [[Queen Mathilde of Belgium|Queen Mathilde]].{{cite news|title=Macri ya está en Bruselas para negociar con la Unión Europea|url=http://www.clarin.com/politica/Macri-Bruselas-negociar-Union-Europea_0_1606639407.html|accessdate=2 July 2016|work=Clarín|date= 2 July 2016}} |- |{{flag|Germany}} |[[Berlin]] |5–6 July |{{further|Argentina–Germany relations}}President Macri traveled to [[Berlin]] for an official visit to Germany. This was announced by Foreign Minister [[Susana Malcorra]] in a press conference shared with the [[Minister for Foreign Affairs (Germany)|German Minister of Foreign Affairs]], [[Frank-Walter Steinmeier]] in Buenos Aires.{{cite news|title=Macri viajará el 5 de Julio a Alemania para reunirse con Angela Merkel|url=http://www.sinmordaza.com/noticia/364015-macri-recibio-al-ministro-de-relaciones-exteriores-aleman.html|accessdate=3 June 2016|work=Sinmordaza|date= 4 June 2016}} He met with Chancellor [[Angela Merkel]] and President [[Joachim Gauck]]. |- |{{flag|United States}} |[[Idaho]] |7–8 July |{{further|Argentina–United States relations}}President Macri traveled to [[Idaho]] to participate in the Sun Valley Conference Summit chaired by tycoon [[Bill Gates]], in the state of [[Idaho]], the northwestern United States. The presence of Macri is given after ended his official visit to France, Belgium and Germany. |- |{{flag|Peru}} |[[Lima]] |28 July |{{further|Argentina–Peru relations}}President Macri traveled to [[Lima]] to participate in the Presidential Inauguration of [[Pedro Pablo Kuczynski]]. |- |{{flag|Brazil}} |[[Rio de Janeiro]] |5 August |{{further|Argentina–Brazil relations}}President Macri traveled to [[Rio de Janeiro]] on the occasion of the [[2016 Summer Olympics opening ceremony]].{{cite news|title=Dilma Rousseff invitó a Mauricio Macri a la apertura de los Juegos Olímpicos|url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1873718-dilma-rousseff-invito-a-mauricio-macri-a-la-apertura-de-los-juegos-olimpicos|accessdate=23 February 2016|work=La Nación|date=23 February 2016}} |- |{{flag|Qatar}} |[[Doha]] |3 September |President Macri met the [[Emir of Qatar]], [[Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani]]. |- |{{flag|China}} |[[Hangzhou]] |4–5 September |{{further|Argentina–China relations}}President Macri traveled to China to attend the [[2016 G-20 Hangzhou summit|G-20 summit meeting]] in Hangzhou. |- |{{flag|United States}} |[[New York City]] |19 September |{{further|Argentina–United States relations}}Macri traveled to New York for the 71st UN General Assembly. |- |{{flag|Colombia}} |[[Cartagena, Colombia|Cartagena de Indias]] |27 September |{{further|Argentina–Colombia relations}}President Macri attended the signing of the Colombia Peace Agreements between President [[Juan Manuel Santos]] and FARC Leader [[Timoleón Jiménez]]. |- |{{flag|Vatican City}}
{{flag|Italy}} |Vatican City
[[Rome]] |15 October |{{further|Argentina–Holy See relations|Argentina-Italy relations}}President Macri visited [[Pope Francis]] along with First Lady [[Juliana Awada]] and their child, Antonia Macri, his daughter Agustina Macri and her daughter Valentina Barbier. Later, the President met with diplomats and traveled to Florence where Prime Minister [[Matteo Renzi]] had a dinner in their honour. The President assisted as well to the Canonization of [[Jose Gabriel del Rosario Brochero|José Gabriel del Rosario Brochero]]. |} ==2017== [[File:Mauricio Macri & Donald Trump at the White House 05.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Melania Trump, Donald Trump, Mauricio Macri and Juliana Awada at the White House.]] [[File:Juliana Awada Mauricio Macri Xi Jinping Peng Liyuan.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Juliana Awada, Mauricio Macri, Xi Jinping and Peng Liyuan at the Great Hall of the People.]] [[File:Juliana Awada Mauricio Macri Shinzo Abe and Akie Abe 20170519.png|thumb|right|200px|Juliana Awada, Mauricio Macri, Shinzō Abe and Akie Abe.]] {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date (s) ! wideth=550|Notes |- |{{flag|Spain}} |[[Madrid]] |20–25 February |{{further|Argentina–Spain relations}}Macri traveled to Spain with 200 businessmen. Met with the [[King Felipe VI]] and Queen [[Letizia Ortiz]], and the [[President of the Government of Spain|President of the Government]] [[Mariano Rajoy]].[http://www.ambito.com/873480-macri-viaja-a-espana-con-200-empresarios-para-iniciar-gira-oficial Macri viaja a España con 200 empresarios para iniciar gira oficial] |- |{{flag|Paraguay}} |[[Asunción]] |16 March |{{further|Argentina–Paraguay relations}}Macri met with the [[President of Paraguay|President]] [[Horacio Cartes]] to cooperate in the fight against narcotraffic on the border and to renegotiate the debt for the construction of the [[Yacyretá Dam]].[http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201703/182595-macri-viaje-al-paraguay-horacio-cartes-reunion-yacyreta-deuda.html Macri y Cartes abordaron la deuda de Yacyretá y el narcotráfico] |- |{{flag|Netherlands}} |[[Amsterdam]] |27–28 March |Macri and Juliana Awade met with the [[King Willem-Alexander]] and [[Queen Máxima]]. They visited the [[Anne Frank House]], [[Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons]] and the [[International Criminal Court]].[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/1999671-mauricio-macri-holanda-reina-maxima-juliana-awada Mauricio Macri en Holanda: el presidente participa de un foro de negocios junto a los reyes] |- |{{flag|United States}} |[[Houston]]
[[Washington, D.C.]] |26–27 April |{{further|Argentina–United States relations}}Macri visited the plants of [[Tenaris]] and [[Dow Chemical Company|Dow]] in Houston.[http://www.telam.com.ar/notas/201704/186852-macri-viaje-washington-donald-trump.html Macri visitó empresas en Texas] The next day he and Juliana Awada met [[Melania Trump|Melania]] and [[Donald Trump]] at the [[White House]]. Trump decided to lift the import embargo of Argentine lemons and agreed to support Argentina's decision to join the [[OECD]].[http://www.infobae.com/politica/2017/04/28/donald-trump-controlo-todos-los-detalles-de-su-reunion-con-mauricio-macri-en-la-casa-blanca/ Donald Trump controló todos los detalles de su reunión con Mauricio Macri en la Casa Blanca] |- |{{flag|United Arab Emirates}} |[[Dubai]] |12 May |Macri and Juliana Awada were accompanied by [[Emilio Monzó]], [[List of Presidents of the Argentine Chamber of Deputies|President of the Chamber of Deputies]]; [[Alberto Weretilneck]], [[Governor of Río Negro Province|Governor]] of [[Río Negro Province|Río Negro]]; [[Sergio Uñac]], [[Governor of San Juan Province|Governor]] of [[San Juan Province, Argentina|San Juan]]; [[Gerardo Morales (politician)|Gerardo Morales]], [[Governor of Jujuy Province|Governor]] of [[Jujuy Province|Jujuy]]; [[Juan José Aranguren]], Minister of Energy; [[Rogelio Frigerio]], [[Ministry of the Interior and Transport|Minister of Interior]] and [[Guillermo Dietrich]], [[Ministry of the Interior and Transport|Minister of Transport]]. They met with the [[List of Prime Ministers of the United Arab Emirates|Prime Minister]] [[Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum]][http://www.perfil.com/politica/macri-visita-hoy-dubai-para-seguir-buscando-inversiones.phtml Macri visita hoy Dubai para seguir buscando inversiones] |- |{{flag|China}} |[[Beijing]]
[[Shanghai]] |14–18 May |{{further|Argentina–China relations}}On Sunday 14 Macri and Juliana Awada met with [[Xi Jinping]] in the [[Great Hall of the People]]. Then they participated in the [[Belt and Road Forum]]. On Monday 15 Macri went to Yanqi Lake International Convention & Exhibition Center and worked with the leaders participating in the Forum. On Tuesday 16 Macri met with businessmen from energy, transport and infrastructure areas. Then went to the [[Chinese Academy of Sciences]] to celebrate the 45th Anniversary of the Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between Argentina and China. On Wednesday 17 Macri and Juliana Awada deposited a wreath in the [[Monument to the People's Heroes]], in the [[Tiananmen Square]]. Then Macri met in the Great Hall of the People with the [[Premier of the People's Republic of China]], [[Li Keqiang]], and then with the [[Chairman of the Standing Committee of the National People's Congress|Chairman]] of the [[Standing Committee of the National People's Congress]], [[Zhang Dejiang]]. On Thursday 18 Macri went to Shanghai to the official inauguration of the Pavilion of the Argentine Republic in the SIAL-China Exhibition at the [[Shanghai New International Expo Center|New International Expo Center]].[http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2023239-mauricio-macri-arribo-a-dubai-primera-escala-de-su-gira-asiatica Mauricio Macri arribó a Dubai, primera escala de su gira asiática] |- |{{flag|Japan}} |[[Tokyo]] |18–19 May |{{further|Argentina–Japan relations}}Macri shared a breakfast with Japanese businessmen at [[Prince Hotels|The Prince Park Tower Tokyo Hotel]]. In that place he said a few words at the opening of the Japan-Argentina Economic Forum. Then Macri and Juliana Awada met with the [[Prime Minister of Japan|Prime Minister]] [[Shinzō Abe]] and his wife [[Akie Abe]] at the official residence. Macri was received by the chairman of [[Toyota]], [[Takeshi Uchiyamada]]. On Friday 19 Macri and Juliana Awada went to the [[Meiji Shrine]] and then met with the [[Emperor Akihito]] and [[Empress Michiko]] in the [[Tokyo Imperial Palace]].[http://www.infobae.com/politica/2017/05/18/mauricio-macri-llega-a-japon-cuales-seran-sus-actividades/ Mauricio Macri ya está en Japón: "al mundo le interesa ayudar a la Argentina"] |- |{{flag|Ecuador}} |[[Quito]] |24 May |Macri traveled to Ecuador to attend the inauguration of [[Lenín Moreno]] as new [[President of Ecuador]]. |- |{{flag|Chile}} |[[Santiago de Chile]] |27 June |Macri traveled to Chile for a meeting with President [[Michelle Bachelet]], which whom he discussed integration prospects between [[Mercosur]] and the [[Pacific Alliance]].{{cite web |url=http://www.lanacion.com.ar/2037493-mauricio-macri-se-reunio-con-michelle-bachelet-en-chile-y-pidio-avanzar-en-la-integracion-del-mercosur-y-la-alianza-del-pacifico |title=Mauricio Macri se reunió con Michelle Bachelet en Chile y pidió avanzar en la integración del Mercosur y la Alianza del Pacífico |last= |first= |date= 27 June 2017 |website= |publisher=La Nación |access-date= 30 June 2017 |language=Spanish}} |- | {{flag|Germany}} | [[Hamburg]] |7-8 July | [[2017 G20 Hamburg summit]] |} ==2018== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{flag|Chile}} |[[Valparaíso]] |11 March |Ceremony of inauguration of the Chilean president [[Sebastian Piñera]] |- | {{flag|Peru}} | [[Lima]] |13-14 April |[[8th Summit of the Americas]] |- | {{flag|Canada}} | [[La Malbaie]] |8-10 June | [[44th G7 summit]] |} ==Future trips== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=120|Country ! width=100|Areas visited ! width=90|Date(s) ! width=550|Notes |- |{{flag|Guatemala}} |[[Antigua Guatemala]] |15–16 November 2018 |{{further|Argentina–Guatemala relations}} [[Ibero-American Summit]] |- |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Foreign relations of Argentina}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Presidential trips made by Mauricio Macri}} [[Category:Presidency of Mauricio Macri]] [[Category:21st century-related lists]] [[Category:Diplomatic visits by heads of government|Macri, Mauricio]] [[Category:Lists of diplomatic visits by heads of state|Macri, Mauricio]] [[Category:Geography-related lists]] [[Category:Lists of diplomatic trips|Macri, Mauricio]]

|[[Iceland]] || {{flag|Iceland}} ||align="right" | 350,710 ||align="right" | 101,826||align="right" | {{nts|3.4}} |2018 | |} == Least densely populated islands == There are numerous [[Desert island|uninhabited or deserted islands]]. The largest uninhabited island in the world is [[Devon Island]] in [[Canada]]. * [[Greenland]] (part of [[Denmark]]) population 56,452; area 2,166,086 square kilometres/836,109 square miles = 1 person per 38.37 square kilometres/14.81 square miles or 0.02 persons per square kilometre/0.06 persons per square mile. * [[Baffin Island]] (part of [[Nunavut]], [[Canada]]) population 11,000; area 507,451 square km/195,927.9 square mi = 1 person per 46.13 km2/17.81 sq mi or 0.02 persons per km2/0.05 persons per sq mi. * [[Victoria Island (Canada)]] population 1,875; area 217,291 km2/83,897 sq mi = 1 person per 115.88 km2/44.7 sq mi or 0.009 persons per km2/0.02 persons per sq mi. * [[Ellesmere Island]] (part of [[Nunavut]], [[Canada]]) population 146; area 196,235 km2/75,767 sq mi = 1 person per 1,344.08 km2/518.95 sq mi or 0.000744 persons per km2/0.0019 persons per sq mi. ==See also== {{Portal|Islands}} * [[List of islands]] * [[List of islands by population]] * [[List of islands by area]] * [[Populated islands of the Great Lakes]] * [[Hashima Island]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2010}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Islands by population density}} [[Category:Lists of islands| ]] [[Category:Geography-related lists]] [[Category:Lists by population density]]

revision.text:
[[File:Physical World Map 2004-04-01.jpeg|thumb|right|400px|Physiographic world map with mountain ranges and highland areas in brown, pink, and gray]] This is a list of [[mountain range]]s on [[Earth]] and a few other [[astronomical object|astronomical bodies]]. First, the highest and longest mountain ranges on Earth are listed, followed by more comprehensive alphabetical lists organized by continent. Ranges in the oceans and on other celestial bodies are listed afterwards.
== Mountain ranges on Earth==
===By height=== #[[Mahalangur Himal]] (part of Greater Himalayas) – Asia: {{flag|Nepal}}, {{flag|India}}, {{flag|China}}, {{flag|Pakistan}}, {{flag|Bhutan}}; highest point: [[Everest]], 8848 meters above sea level. #[[Karakoram]] (part of Greater Himalayas) – Asia: {{flag|Pakistan}}, {{flag|China}}, {{flag|India}}; highest point: [[K2]], 8611 meters above sea level. #[[Hindu Kush]] (part of Greater Himalayas) – Asia: {{flag|Afghanistan}}, {{flag|Pakistan}}, {{flag|India}}; highest point: [[Tirich Mir]], 7708 meters above sea level. #[[Pamirs]] (part of Greater Himalayas) – Asia: {{flag|Tajikistan}}, {{flag|Kyrgyzstan}}, {{flag|China}}, {{flag|Afghanistan}}; highest point: [[Kongur Tagh]], 7649 meters above sea level, a peak included in the "Eastern Pamirs" <ref>{{cite web |url= http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1029/93TC00767/abstract |title= High cooling and denudation rates at Kongur Shan, Eastern Pamir (Xinjiang, China) |author1=N. O. Arnaud |author2=M. Brunel |author3=J. M. Cantagr4=P. Tapponnier |date= 1993 |journal= Tectonics |volume=12 |issue=3 |publisher=[[American Geophysical Union]] Publications |pages=1335–1346 |accessdate=2015-05-02}}</ref> more often than in the [[Kunlun Mountains]], as Kongur Tagh and the Kunlun range are ''separated'' by the large [[Yarkand River]] valley; no valley of such significance separates the Pamirs and Kongur Tagh, just political boundaries. #[[Hengduan Mountains]] (part of Greater Himalayas) – Asia: {{flag|China}}, {{flag|Myanmar}}; highest point: [[Mount Gongga]], 7556 meters above sea level. #[[Tian Shan]] – Asia: {{flag|China}}, {{flag|Kyrgyzstan}}, {{flag|Kazakhstan}}, {{flag|Uzbekistan}}; highest point: [[Jengish Chokusu]], 7439 meters above sea level. #[[Kunlun Mountains|Kunlun]] (part of Greater Himalayas) – Asia: {{flag|China}}; highest point: [[Liushi Shan]], 7167 meters above sea level. #[[Nyenchen Tanglha]] (part of Greater Himalayas) – Asia; {{flag|China}}; highest point: [[Mount Nyenchen Tanglha]], 7162 meters above sea level. #[[Andes]] – South America: {{flag|Argentina}}, {{flag|Chile}}, {{flag|Peru}}, {{flag|Bolivia}}, {{flag|Ecuador}}, {{flag|Colombia}}, {{flag|Venezuela}}; highest point: [[Aconcagua]], 6962 meters above sea level. #[[Alaska Range]] – North America: {{flag|United States}}; highest point: [[Denali]], 6194 meters above sea level.
All of the Asian ranges above have been formed in part over the past 35 to 55 million years by the collision between the [[Indian Plate]] and [[Eurasian Plate]]. The Indian Plate is still particularly mobile and these mountain ranges continue to rise in elevation every year; of these the Himalayas are rising most quickly; the [[Kashmir]] and [[Pamirs]] region to the north of the Indian subcontinent is the point of confluence of these mountains which encircle the [[Tibetan Plateau]] on three sides.
===By prominence=== See [[List of peaks by prominence]] (ranking the mountain ranges as well).

/* Sources */ Fix incorrect ref formatting – [[:Category:Pages with incorrect ref formatting|You can help!]]
revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=July 2014}}
While [[compass surveying]], the magnetic needle is sometimes disturbed from its normal position under the influence of external attractive forces. Such a disturbing influence is called as '''local attraction'''.<ref>surveying volume 1 by Dr B.c Punmia and Ashok Kumar Jain. Chapter Compass Surveying</ref> The external forces are produced by sources of local attraction which may be current carrying wire (magnetic materials) or [[metal]] objects.<ref>surveying by prof. Sk Duggal available on internet from Google books</ref> The term is also used to denote amount of deviation of the needle from its normal position. It mostly causes errors in observations while [[surveying]] and thus suitable methods are employed to neglect these errors.<ref>Surveying by prof. Cl Kocher ,Principal of Mehar chand Polytechnic College, [[Jalandhar]] City, [[Punjab]]/Compass Surveying</ref>
==Sources== The sources of local attraction may be natural or artificial. Natural sources include [[Iron ores]] or magnetic rocks while as artificial sources consist of steel structures, iron pipes, current carrying [[Electrical resistivity and conductivity|conductors]]. The [[iron]] made [[surveying]] instruments such as metric chains, ranging rods and arrows should also be kept at a safe distance apart from [[compass]].<ref>surveying by Prof. Aftab Ahmad</ref>
==Detection== Local attraction at a place can be detected by observing bearings from both ends of the line in the area. If fore bearing and back bearing of a line differ exactly by 180°, there is no local attraction at either station. But if this difference is not equal to 180°, then local attraction exists there either at one or both ends of the line.<ref>surveying by Prof. Cl Kocher</ref>
==Remedies== There are two common methods of correcting observed bearings of the lines taken in the area affected by Local Attraction. The first method involves '''correcting the bearing with the help of corrected included angles''' and the second method involves correcting the '''bearing of traverse from one correct bearing''' ( in which difference between fore bearing and back bearing is exactly equal to 180°) by the process of distribution of error to other bearings.<ref>Surveying by Dr. Bc Punmia/Compass Surveying</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Surveying]] [[Category:Civil engineering]]

revision.text:
[[File:Peruvianterracefarmers.jpg|thumb|right|270px|Human-environmental relations in the [[Peruvian]] [[Andes]].]] [[File:Sunset at Kucherla lake.jpg|thumb|right|270px|[[Lake Kucherla]] in the [[Altai Mountains]].]] [[File:Andorra la Vella 3.JPG|thumb|right|270px|[[Andorra la Vella]], a mountain state's capital in the [[Pyrenees]].]] [[File:Taktshang.jpg|thumb|right|270px|[[Paro Taktsang]], a Himalayan monastery in [[Bhutan]].]] [[File:The night view of Kofu City.jpg|thumb|right|270px|[[Kōfu]], a Japanese mountain city.]] '''Mountain research''' or ''[[Mountain research#Denomination|montology]]'', traditionally also known as ''orology''<ref>http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/orology Merriam Webster</ref> (from [[Greek language|Greek]] ''oros'' ὄρος for 'mountain' and ''logos'' λόγος), is a field of research that regionally concentrates on the [[Earth's surface]]'s part covered by [[mountain]] [[landscape]]s.
==Mountain areas== Different approaches have been developed to define ''mountainous'' areas. While some use an altitudinal difference of 300 [[meter|m]] inside an area to define that zone as mountainous,<ref>{{cite journal | doi=10.1553/eco.mont-5-1s3 | volume=5 | title=Editorial | journal=eco.mont (Journal on Protected Mountain Areas Research) | pages=3–4}}</ref> others consider differences from 1000 m or more,<ref>http://www.unep.org/maweb/documents/document.293.aspx.pdf Mountain Systems. UNEP</ref> depending on the areas' [[latitude]]. Additionally, some include steepness to define mountain regions, hence excluding [[high plateau]]s (e.g. the Andean [[Altiplano]] or the [[Tibetan Plateau]]), zones often seen to be mountainous. A more pragmatic but useful definition has been proposed by the Italian Statistics Office [[National Institute of Statistics (Italy)|ISTAT]], which classifies municipalities as mountainous
* if at least 80% of their territory is situated above ≥ 600 m [[above sea level]], and/or * if they have an altitudinal difference of 600 m (or more) within their administrative boundaries.<ref>http://www.istat.it/it/archivio/147760 Precisazione sulla classificazione dei comuni montani</ref>
The [[United Nations Environmental Programme]] has produced a map<ref>http://www.arcgis.com/home/webmap/viewer.html?useExisting=1&layers=0a5d90defc33466cbc3eb85a6564b6d6 UNEP-WCNC (2011): Mountains of the World – 2000. Map</ref><ref>http://old.unep-wcmc.org/mountains-and-forests-in-mountains-2000_723.html UNEP-WCNC (2011): Mountains of the World – 2000. Data</ref> of mountain areas worldwide using a combination of criteria, including regions with
* elevations from 300 to 1000 m and local elevation range [[Greater-than sign|>]] 300 m; * elevations from 1000 to 1500 m and slope [[≥]] 5[[°]] or local elevation range > 300 m; * elevations from 1500 to 2500 m and slope ≥ 2°; * elevations of 2500 m or more.
==Focus==
===Broader definition=== In a broader sense, mountain research is considered any research ''in'' mountain regions: for instance disciplinary studies on Himalayan [[Plant (botanical)|plants]], Andean [[Rock (geology)|rocks]], Alpine [[City|cities]], or Carpathian [[Ethnic group|people]]. It is comparable to research that concentrates on the [[Arctic]] and [[Antarctic]] (polar research) or [[coast]]s (coastal research).
===Narrower definition=== In a narrower sense, mountain research focuses ''on'' mountain regions, their description and the explanation of the [[Integrated geography|human-environment interaction]] in ([[Positive science|positive]]) and the [[sustainable development]] of ([[normative]]) these areas. So-defined mountain research is situated at the nexus of [[natural science]]s, [[social science]]s and [[humanities]]. Drawing on [[Alexander von Humboldt]]'s work in the [[Andes|Andean realm]], [[Geography|mountain geography]] and [[Landscape ecology|ecology]] are considered core areas of study; nevertheless important contributions are coming from [[anthropology]], [[geology]], [[economics]], [[history]] or [[spatial planning]]. In sum, a narrowly defined mountain research applies an interdisciplinary and integrative regional approach. [[Olav Slaymaker|Slaymaker]] summarizes:
{{Quotation|The science of montology [...] starts with recognition of the importance of verticality, a distinctive feature of mountain regions, which imposes vertical control of the production system; marginality, which results from low agricultural potential; centrality of mechanisms of power and violence; population growth and expansion; and religion and myth, expressed in mountains as sacred places. Montology emphasises restoration ecology to include re-vegetation, rehabilitation, reclamation and recovery of the lost landscape form and function [...]. Landscape ecological effects are arranged along altitudinal belts and form the basis for a more comprehensive understanding of critical habitats for conservation and development. This approach has an underlying assumption of climax communities each fitting into a narrow altitudinal band.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Slaymaker | first1 = O | year = 2007 | title = The potential contribution of geomorphology to tropical mountain development: The case of the MANRECUR project | url = | journal = Geomorphology | volume = 87 | issue = 1–2| pages = 90–100 | doi = 10.1016/j.geomorph.2006.06.044 }}</ref>}}
==Denomination== Mountain research or ''orology''—not to be confused with [[orography]]—, is sometimes denominated ''montology''. This term stems from Carl Troll's ''mountain geoecology''—geoecology being Troll's English translation of the German ''[[Landscape ecology|Landschaftsökologie]]''—and appeared at a meeting in [[Cambridge, Massachusetts]] in 1977.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Neustadtl | first1 = SJ | year = 1977 | title = Montology: the Ecology of Mountains | url = | journal = Technology Review | volume = 79 | issue = 8| pages = 64–66 | doi = }}</ref> Since then, scholars such as Jack D. Ives, Bruno Messerli and Robert E. Rhoades have claimed the development of montology as interdisciplinary mountain research. The term montology was included in the [[Oxford English Dictionary]] in 2002.<ref>http://www.oed.com/public/update0212/december-2002-update</ref> It defines montology as:
{{Quotation|The study of mountains; specifically the interdisciplinary study of the physical, chemical, geological, and biological aspects of mountain regions; (also) the study of the lifestyles and economic concerns of people living in these regions.<ref>http://www.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/english/montology</ref>}}
On the one hand, the term ''montology'' received criticism due to the mix of [[Latin language|Latin]] (''mōns'', [[Plural|pl.]] ''montēs'') and [[Greek language|Greek]] (''logos''). On the other hand, however, this is also the—well accepted—case in several, already established disciplines such as [[glaciology]] or [[sociology]].
==Mountain research journals== The following list includes peer-reviewed journals that have a focus on mountain research and are open to both the natural and the social sciences:
{| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 0.5em 0.5em 0.5em 1em; padding: 0.5em; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 85%;" cellspacing="0" align="center" |- ! colspan="2" style="background:#DDDDDD;" | Journals covered by [[citation index|citation indices]] |- | Mountain Research and Development | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]], [[Web of Science]] * articles in [[English language|English]] * [http://www.mrd-journal.org official website] |- | Journal of Mountain Science | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]], [[Web of Science]] * articles in [[English language|English]] * [http://jms.imde.ac.cn official website] |- | Journal of Alpine Research / Revue de géographie alpine | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]], [[Web of Science]] * articles in [[English language|English]], [[French language|French]], [[German language|German]], [[Italian language|Italian]], [[Spanish language|Spanish]] * [http://rga.revues.org official website] |- | eco.mont | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]], [[Web of Science]] * articles in [[English language|English]] * [http://www.oeaw.ac.at/ecomont official website] |- | Appalachian Journal | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]], [[Web of Science]] * articles in [[English language|English]] * [http://appjournal.appstate.edu official website] |- | Pirineos | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]] * articles in [[English language|English]], [[Spanish language|Spanish]] * [http://pirineos.revistas.csic.es official website] |- | Histoire des Alpes – Storia delle Alpi – Geschichte der Alpen | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]] * articles in [[French language|French]], [[Italian language|Italian]], [[German language|German]] * [http://www.labisalp.arc.usi.ch/it/pubblicazioni/histoire-des-alpes-storia-delle-alpi-geschichte-der-alpen official website] |- | Bulletin de l’Institut français d’études andines | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]] * articles in [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[French language|French]] * [http://bifea.revues.org official website] |- | HIMALAYA | * indexed in [[SCOPUS]] * articles in [[English language|English]] * [http://www.himalayajournal.org official website] |- ! colspan="2" style="background:#DDDDDD;" | Journals not covered by citation indices |- | Himalayan Journal of Sciences | * articles in [[English language|English]] * [http://www.nepjol.info/index.php/HJS official website] |- | Revista Andina | * articles in [[Spanish language|Spanish]] * [http://revistaandinacbc.com official website] |- | L’Italia Forestale e Montana / Italian Journal of Forest and Mountain Environments | * articles in [[English language|English]], [[Italian language|Italian]] * [http://ojs.aisf.it/index.php/ifm official website] |- | Beskydy – The Beskids Bulletin | * articles in [[English language|English]] * [http://beskydy.mendelu.cz official website] |- | Устойчивое развитие горных территорий / Sustainable Development of Mountain Territories | * articles in [[Russian language|Russian]] * [http://naukagor.ru/en-gb/ official website] |- | Journal of Mountain Agriculture on the Balkans | * articles in [[Bulgarian language|Bulgarian]], [[English language|English]] * [http://rimsa.eu/index.php/journal/ official website] |-
|}
==Mountain research personalities== {| | width="33%" valign="top" | * [[Nigel J. R. Allen]] * [[Yuri P. Badenkov]] * [[Werner Bätzing]] * [[Axel Borsdorf]] * [[Philippe Bourdeau]] * [[Bernard Debarbieux]] * [[Veronica della Dora]] * [[Olivier Dollfus]] * [[Don C. Funnel]] * [[Donald A. Friend]] * [[Daniel W. Gade]] * [[José M. García Ruiz]] * [[Stephan Halloy]] * [[Lawrence S. Hamilton]] * [[Hans Hurni]] * [[Jack D. Ives]]
| width="33%" valign="top" |
* [[Hans Kinzl]] * [[Thomas Kohler (geographer)|Thomas Kohler]] * [[Wilhelm Lauer]] * [[Elisabeth Lichtenberger]] * [[Bruno Messerli]] * [[Dorothy Jane Pratt]] * [[Roderick Peattie]] * [[Martin F. Price]] * [[Robert E. Rhoades]] * [[Fausto O. Sarmiento]] * [[Jörg Stadelbauer]] * [[Olav Slaymaker]] * [[David Smethurst]] * [[Christoph Stadel]] * [[Carl Troll]]
|}
==See also== * [[Mountain Research and Development]] * [http://jms.imde.ac.cn Journal of Mountain Science] * [[eco.mont|eco.mont – Journal on Protected Mountain Areas Research and Management]] * [[Mountain Partnership]]
==Websites== * [http://mri.scnatweb.ch/ MRI Mountain Research Initiative] * [http://www.mtnforum.org/ The Mountain Forum] * [http://community.aag.org/mountaingeography/home AAG Mountain Geography Specialty Group]
==Further reading== * {{cite journal | last1 = Borsdorf | first1 = A. | last2 = Braun | first2 = V. | year = 2008 | title = The European and Global Dimension of Mountain Research: An Overview | url = | journal = Revue de géographie alpine | volume = 96 | issue = 4| pages = 117–129 | doi = 10.4000/rga.630 }} * {{cite journal | last1 = Debarbieux | first1 = B. | last2 = Price | first2 = M. F. | year = 2008 | title = Representing Mountains: From Local and National to Global Common Good | url = https://archive-ouverte.unige.ch/unige:3978/ATTACHMENT01| journal = Geopolitics | volume = 13 | issue = 1| pages = 148–168 | doi = 10.1080/14650040701783375 }} * {{cite journal | last1 = Ives | first1 = J. D. | last2 = Messerli | first2 = B. | year = 1999 | title = AD 2002 Declared by United Nations as "International Year of the Mountains" | url = | journal = Arctic, Antarctic, and Alpine Research | volume = 31 | issue = 3| pages = 11–213 | doi = 10.2307/1552249 }}

page.title: Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics

revision.comment: /* top */ make the given reason actually appear
revision.text:
{{update|reason=NUTS areas in several countries which were redefined on 1 January 2015 according to the [http://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/EN/TXT/?uri=CELEX:32013R1319&qid=1424619776551 Commission Regulation (EU) No 1319/2013 of 9 December 2013 amending annexes to Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS)]|date=February 2015}} {{engvarB|date=May 2013}} {{use dmy dates|date=May 2013}} The '''Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics''' ('''NUTS'''; {{lang-fr|Nomenclature des unités territoriales statistiques}}) is a [[geocode]] [[standardization|standard]] for referencing the [[country subdivision|subdivisions]] of [[country|countries]] for statistical purposes.{{cite web|url=http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts|title=NUTS – Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics |publisher=Ec.europa.eu |date= |accessdate=2016-12-18}}[http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/statistics_explained/index.php/NUTS European Commission wiki] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100219053638/http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/statistics_explained/index.php/NUTS |date=19 February 2010 }}{{cite web|url=http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:32008R0176:EN:NOT |title=Regulation (EC) No 176/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 20 February 2008 |publisher=Eur-lex.europa.eu |date= |accessdate=2013-03-24}}{{cite web|url=http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:32005R1888:EN:NOT |title=Regulation (EC) No 1888/2005 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 October 2005 |publisher=Eur-lex.europa.eu |date= |accessdate=2013-03-24}}{{cite web|url=http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:32007R0105:EN:NOT |title=Commission Regulation (EC) No 105/2007 of 1 February 2007 |publisher=Eur-lex.europa.eu |date= |accessdate=2013-03-24}}{{cite web|url=http://eur-lex.europa.eu/LexUriServ/LexUriServ.do?uri=CELEX:32003R1059:EN:NOT |title=Regulation (EC) No 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 26 May 2003 |publisher=Eur-lex.europa.eu |date= |accessdate=2013-03-24}} The standard is developed and regulated by the [[European Union]], and thus only covers the [[Member State of the European Union|member states of the EU]] in detail. The Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics is instrumental in the European Union's [[Structural Fund]] delivery mechanisms and for locating the area where goods and services subject to European [[Government procurement in the European Union|public procurement]] legislation are to be delivered. For each EU member country, a hierarchy of three NUTS levels is established by [[Eurostat]] in agreement with each member state; the subdivisions in some levels do not necessarily correspond to [[administrative division]]s within the country. A NUTS code begins with a two-letter code referencing the country, which is identical to the [[ISO 3166-1 alpha-2]] code (except ''UK'' instead of ''GB'' for the United Kingdom and ''EL'' instead of ''GR'' for Greece). The subdivision of the country is then referred to with one number. A second or third subdivision level is referred to with another number each. Each numbering starts with 1, as 0 is used for the upper level. Where the subdivision has more than nine entities, capital letters are used to continue the numbering. A similar statistical system is defined for the [[Future enlargement of the European Union#Recognised candidates|candidate countries]] and members of the [[European Free Trade Association]], but they are not technically part of NUTS governed by the regulations. The current NUTS classification, valid from 1 January 2015, lists 98 regions at NUTS 1, 276 regions at NUTS 2 and 1342 regions at NUTS 3 level.[http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/overview Official Eurostat website: NUTS Overview.] Commission Regulation 2016/2066, dated 21 November 2016, provides for a further amendment following territorial reorganisations in several member states, which will become effective for submission of statistical data to the European Commission from 1 January 2018.Commission Regulation (EU) 2016/2066 amending the annexes to Regulation (EC) 1059/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS) ==Levels== {{see also|First-level NUTS of the European Union}} [[File:NUTS 1 regions EU-27.svg|thumb|300px|NUTS 1 as valid until 2014]] [[File:NUTS 2 regions EU-27.svg|thumb|300px|NUTS 2 as valid until 2014]] [[File:NUTS 3 regions EU-27.svg|thumb|300px|NUTS 3 as valid until 2014]] There are three levels of NUTS defined, with two levels of [[local administrative unit]]s (LAUs) below. These were called NUTS levels 4 and 5 until July 2003, but were officially abolished by regulation, although they are sometimes still described as such. Note that not all countries have every level of division, depending on their size. One of the most extreme cases is Luxembourg, which has only LAUs; the three NUTS divisions each correspond to the entire country itself. {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#ddd;" ! colspan=2 | Countries ! colspan=2 | [[First-level NUTS of the European Union|NUTS 1]] ! colspan=2 | NUTS 2 ! colspan=2 | NUTS 3 |- style="background:#abcdef" | '''[[Member State of the European Union|EU of Scotland#Council areas|Council Areas or Islands Areas]] | align=right | 23 |- | Northern Ireland | align=right | 1 | — | align=right | 1 | Groups of [[Districts of Northern Ireland|districts]] | align=right | 5 |- style="background:#abcdef" | '''[[Future enlargement of the European Union#Recognised candidates|Candidate countries]]''' | align=right | '''6''' | | align=right | '''15''' | | align=right | '''37''' | | align=right | '''133''' |- | Albania | [[NUTS of Albania|AL]] | — | align=right | 1 | Regions (non-administrative) | align=right | 3 | [[Counties of Albania|Counties]] | Serbia|Regions]] | align=right | 5 | [[Districts of Serbia|Districts]] | align=right | 29 |- | Turkey | [[NUTS of Turkey|TR]] | Regions | align=right | 12 | Sub-regions | align=right | 26 | [[Provinces of Turkey|Provinces]] | align=right | 81 |- style="background:#abcdef" | '''[[European Free Trade Association|EFTA]] countries''' | align=right | '''3''' | | align=right | '''3''' | | align="right" | 26 |- | Iceland | [[NUTS of Iceland|IS]] | — | align=right | 1 | — | align=right | 1 | [[Capital Region (Iceland)|Capital Region]] / Rest of country | align=right | 2 |- | Liechtenstein | [[NUTS of Liechtenstein|LI]] | — | align=right | 1 | — | align=right | 1 | — | align=right | 1 |- | Norway | [[NUTS of Norway|NO]] | — | align=right | 1 | Regions | align=right | 7 | [[Counties of Norway|Counties]] | align=right | 19 |} ==Establishment== NUTS regions are generally based on existing national administrative subdivisions. In countries where only one or two regional subdivisions exist, or where the size of existing subdivisions is too small or too large, a second and/or third level is created. This may be on the first level (ex. France, Italy, Greece, and Spain), on the second (ex. Germany) and/or third level (ex. Belgium).{{cite web|url=http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/nuts/basicnuts_regions_en.html |title=Europa – Eurostat – Regions – Basic principles of the NUTS |publisher=Ec.europa.eu |date= |accessdate=2013-03-24}} In smaller countries, where the entire country would be placed on the NUTS 2 or even NUTS 3 level (ex. Luxembourg, Cyprus), the regions at levels 1, 2 and 3 are identical to each other (and also to the entire country), but are coded with the appropriate length codes levels 1, 2 and 3. The NUTS system favors existing administrative units, with one or more assigned to each NUTS level. From the NUTS Regulation, the average population size of the regions in the respective level shall lie within the following thresholds: {| class="wikitable" |+ ! Level !! Minimum !! Maximum |- | NUTS 1 | 3 million | 7 million |- | NUTS 2 | 800,000 | 3 million |- | NUTS 3 | 150,000 | 800,000 |} For non-administrative units, deviations exist for particular geographical, socio-economic, historical, cultural or environmental circumstances, especially for islands and outermost regions. ==Examples== * DE: Germany ** DE7: [[Hessen]] – The ''[[States of Germany|Bundesland]]'' as the top level subdivision of Germany *** DE71: [[Darmstadt (region)|Darmstadt region]] – ''[[Regierungsbezirk]]'' as second level **** DE71E: [[Wetteraukreis]] – ''[[Districts of Germany|Kreis]]'' as the third level ==See also== * [[ISO 3166]] * [[ISO 3166-1]] * [[ISO 3166-2]] * [[List of FIPS region codes]] * [[List of metropolitan areas in Europe by population]] ** [[Larger Urban Zones|List of metropolitan areas (LUZ) in the European Union]] ** [[Largest urban areas of the European Union|List of the largest urban areas of the European Union]] * [[List of European regions by GDP]] * [[Local administrative unit]] * [[Region (Europe)|Regions of the European Union]] ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{commonscat|NUTS}} * [http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/overview Eurostat portal – NUTS – Nomenclature of territorial units for statistics – Overview] ** [http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/history History of NUTS – Changes between versions] ** [http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/nuts-maps-.pdf- NUTS maps (.pdf)] ** [http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/statistical-regions-outside-eu Statistical regions outside the EU] ** [http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/national-structures-eu Correspondence between the NUTS levels and the national structures (EU)] ** [http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/web/nuts/correspondence-tables/national-structures-non-eu Correspondence between the NUTS levels and the national structures (non-EU)] * [http://simap.ted.europa.eu/web/simap/nuts List of current NUTS codes at SIMAP (EU procurement portal)] * [https://github.com/jgaffuri/Nuts2json NUTS regions for web maps in JSON format] * [http://nuts.geovocab.org/ NUTS classification as Linked Data] * [http://www.statoids.com/ Administrative Divisions of Countries ("Statoids")] {{-}} {{NUTS}} {{Geocoding-systems}} {{primary sources|date=August 2016}} '''Opera Corcontica - Scientific Journal from the Krkonoše National Park''' is a [[Czech Republic]]-based yearly journal that publishes peer-reviewed, original papers relating to the [[Giant Mountains]] range, in the fields of environmental sciences, geography and geosciences, humanities and social sciences.
Mainly Czech and Polish scientists contribute; articles are in Czech, Polish or English. The journal also covers the Czech [[Krkonoše National Park]] and Polish [[Karkonosze National Park]].
The name ''Corcontica'' refers to the [[Corconti]], who lived in the Giant Mountains range, known also as the ''[[Riesengebirge]]'', ''Krkonoše'' and ''Karkonosze''.
*ISSN 0139-925X (print) *ISSN 1803-1412 (on-line)
== External links == *[http://opera.krnap.cz/?lang=en Website] *[https://scholar.google.de/scholar?q=Opera+Corcontica&hl=en&lr=&btnG=Search Search at Google Scholar]
[[Category:Geography journals]] [[Category:Sudetes]]
{{geo-journal-stub}}
